page.title: 15The Police in Halewood.
page.content: A class visited the local police station. From our visit we found out a number of things. In Halewood, police officers, either men or women, were given the same jobs to do. There are about 50 officers in our local police station, the highest rank being a sergeant in the uniform and C.I.D. sections. Most of the policemen patrol on foot. Halewood has always had a police station. The original stations were a cottage on Greenbridge Lane replaced by a larger house on the same lane. The present station on Leathers Lane was completed in 1965 and has a charge office, an enquiry desk and four cells for prisoners plus interview rooms, offices and C.I.D. sections. Some schools have a police officer attached to the school as well as there being a junior liason officer.
